title: [fix](catalog) do not call makeSureInitialized when create table from hms meta event
body:
## Proposed changes

When syncing CreateTableEvent of AlterTableEvent from hive metastore, Doris will write an edit log for it.
And when replaying this edit log, the `makeSureInitialized()` will be called in `createTable()` method.
But when replaying, the Master FE is not ready to serve, but `makeSureInitialized()` may forward some request
to Msater FE, which may cause following error:

```
failed to forward init catalog hive operation to master.
java.lang.Exception: Current catalog is not ready, please wait for a while.
	at org.apache.doris.qe.MasterCatalogExecutor.forward(MasterCatalogExecutor.java:46) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.datasource.ExternalCatalog.makeSureInitialized(ExternalCatalog.java:131) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.catalog.external.ExternalDatabase.makeSureInitialized(ExternalDatabase.java:110) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.catalog.external.HMSExternalDatabase.dropTable(HMSExternalDatabase.java:178) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.datasource.CatalogMgr.replayDropExternalTable(CatalogMgr.java:651) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.persist.EditLog.loadJournal(EditLog.java:954) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env.replayJournal(Env.java:2519) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env.transferToMaster(Env.java:1286) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env.access$1200(Env.java:281) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.catalog.Env$4.runOneCycle(Env.java:2417) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
	at org.apache.doris.common.util.Daemon.run(Daemon.java:116) ~[doris-fe.jar:1.2-SNAPSHOT]
```

In this PR, I remove the `makeSureInitialized()` call in `createTable()` method, because it is wrong and useless.
And also rename the methed's name to make it more clear.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by one committer.

title: [fix](planner) fix push filter through agg
body:
## Proposed changes

In the previous implementation, the check for groupby  exprs was ignored. Add this necessary check to make sure it would work

You could reproduce it by runnning belowing sql:

```sql
CREATE TABLE t_push_filter_through_agg (col1 varchar(11451) not null, col2 int not null, col3 int not null)
UNIQUE KEY(col1)
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(col1)
BUCKETS 3
PROPERTIES(
    "replication_num"="1"
);

CREATE VIEW `view_i` AS 
SELECT 
    `b`.`col1` AS `col1`, 
    `b`.`col2` AS `col2`
FROM 
(
    SELECT 
        `col1` AS `col1`, 
        sum(`cost`) AS `col2`
    FROM 
    (
        SELECT 
            `col1` AS `col1`, 
            sum(CAST(`col3` AS INT)) AS `cost` 
        FROM 
            `t_push_filter_through_agg` 
        GROUP BY 
            `col1`
    ) a 
    GROUP BY 
        `col1`
) b;

SELECT SUM(`total_cost`) FROM view_a WHERE `dt` BETWEEN '2023-06-12' AND '2023-06-18' LIMIT 1;

```


Error message:

```sql
ERROR 1105 (HY000): errCode = 2, detailMessage = Unexpected exception: Predicate:<slot 13> `dt` >= '2023-06-12 00:00:00' can't be assigned to some PlanNode. 
```
## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

## Proposed changes

Problem: when using nereids planner, some constant folding does not work. like: 
explain select case 'a' when 1 then 'a' when 'a' then 'b' else 'other' end as col212;

title: [Fix](orc-reader) Fix orc dict filter null value issue in `_convert_dict_cols_to_string_cols` which caused incorrect result.
body:
## Proposed changes
### Issue
Query results should not have empty values.
```
use regresssion.multi_catalog;
select commit_id from github_events_orc WHERE (event_type = 'CommitCommentEvent') AND commit_id != "" limit 10;
```
```
+------------------------------------------+
| commit_id                                |
+------------------------------------------+
| 685c1fd8dbbdc10c042932f9a9f88be00ff96c75 |
| 685c1fd8dbbdc10c042932f9a9f88be00ff96c75 |
| 4e3ab2ff2d2474f5d51334b9b0fdf17e9845a166 |
|                                          |
|                                          |
|                                          |
|                                          |
|                                          |
|                                          |
| 7191c20cb49da07a7fc16aa32dc0de4faff528b2 |
+------------------------------------------+
10 rows in set (0.54 sec) 
```

### Resolution
- Fix orc dict filter null value issue in `_convert_dict_cols_to_string_cols` which caused incorrect result.
- Rollback to use `insert_many_strings_overflow` for performance.

## Further comments

title: [Fix](mysql proto) avoid send duplicated `OK` packet
body:
## Proposed changes

1. The Mysql Go driver has a logic that terminates when it reads an EOF (end-of-file) and expects no data in the buffer. However, the front-end (FE) mistakenly returns an additional OK packet, which causes an exception to be thrown when reading the buffer.

2. Refactor some logic to support full prepared not just in where clause, like 
```
select ?, ? from tbl
```


Issue Number: close #xxx

title: [Fix](planner)fix failed running alias function with an alias function in original function.
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

failed to run sql:
```sql
create alias function f1(int) with parameter(n) as dayofweek(hours_add('2023-06-18', n))
create alias function f2(int) with parameter(n) as dayofweek(hours_add(makedate(year('2023-06-18'), f1(3)), n))

 select f2(f1(3))
```
it will rise an exception: f1 is not a builtin-function.
because f2's original function contains f1, and f1 is not a builtin-function, should be rewritten firstly.
we should avoid of it. And we will support it later.


## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [opt](stats) Sampling when aggregate column stats
body:
## Proposed changes

In the previous implementation, when aggregating partition statistics into column statistics, the calculation of distinct values (ndv) for the entire column was performed without using sampling, resulting in reduced efficiency of the sampling process.

Before this PR analyze below table which has 1000000 lines would cost 5.75sec, after this PR, it would cost 3.39sec.


```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `duplicate_all` (
    `k3` int(11) null comment "",
    `k0` boolean null comment "",
    `k1` tinyint(4) null comment "",
    `k2` smallint(6) null comment "",
    `k4` bigint(20) null comment "",
    `k5` decimalv3(9, 3) null comment "",
    `k6` char(36) null comment "",
    `k10` date null comment "",
    `k11` datetime null comment "",
    `k7` varchar(64) null comment "",
    `k8` double null comment "",
    `k9` float null comment "",
    `k12` string  null comment "",
    `k13` largeint(40)  null comment ""
) engine=olap
DUPLICATE KEY(`k3`)
DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`k3`) BUCKETS 5 properties("replication_num" = "3")
```

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [feature](jni) add jni metrics and attach to BE profile automatically
body:
## Proposed changes
Add JNI metrics, for example:
```
-  HudiJniScanner:  0ns
  -  FillBlockTime:  31.29ms
  -  GetRecordReaderTime:  1m5s
  -  JavaScanTime:  35s991ms
  -  OpenScannerTime:  1m6s
```
Add three common performance metrics for JNI scanner:
1. `OpenScannerTime`: Time to init and open JNI scanner
2. `JavaScanTime`: Time to scan data and insert into vector table in java side
3. `FillBlockTime`: Time to convert java vector table to c++ block

And support user defined metrics in java side, for example: `OpenScannerTime` is a long time for the open process, we want to determine which sub-process takes too much time, so we add `GetRecordReaderTime` in java side.
The user defined metrics in java side can be attached to BE profile automatically.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...
